Sentencas: Here we demonstrate that there is a ubiquitous oxygen potential transition rooted in the p-type/n-type transition of electronic conductivity inside mixed conducting oxides, and that the transition is extremely sensitive to electrode potential and current density.

Sentencas: It is also remarkably sensitive to the conductivity ratio of electrons and holes, as well as their association with lattice oxygens and vacancies, which tends to increase the oxygen flow.
